runs.comm: over the wicket, pushed across on a length towards off stump, and this stays low as Kieswetter shoulders arms, bobbling through to the keeper
length ball outside the line of off, Kieswetter watches it through again
tighter line to the stumps, the batsman gets forward in defence
length ball around the line of off, backs away and chops to cover, no run there
pitched up a little more, half forward and punched to mid-on, not a clean strike and that's another dot ball for Zadran

gone, played on! Zadran's arms are outspread in celebration and Kieswetter trudges off after seeing out a wicket maiden to open the match! This one did bounce a bit, the batsman stayed back, tried to open the face and use the pace on the ball and ended up blocking down into the ground in front of the stumps, the ball flicking off the bails on its way back up
length ball, seaming away off the pitch, Hales flashes and gets a BIG outside edge over first slip for four, the first runs of the innings
movement away from the right-hander again, draws Hales into another false stroke and beats the bat
pitched up, slightly fuller, pushed into the covers on the front foot
pandemonium already, Hales tips and runs to mid-off where Mangal picks up and misses with his throw at the bowler's end - would have been gone!
back of a length at the batsman, sits in the crease and blocks
there's definitely some juice in this pitch, Wright hit on the glove as one rears off a length, he manages to jab it towards point
back of a length, slightly outside off, Hales tries to swivel pull but fails to connect
length ball, pushed across and chopped to point, excellent diving stop means that Zadran still hasn't conceded a run
touch full, outside off and drawing Hales into the draw, connects with a crisp shot but again picks out the man at cover - another dot
good length in the corridor outside off, pushed into the ground, slightly wide of mid-off and they hurry through for one
another one stays low as Wright swings and misses outside off
he connects this time, smiting the ball low between point and cover, it slows up on its way to rope but Wright is off the mark
length ball outside off, jabbed short into the off side, "No!" bawls Hales
short this time and at the man, pulled low through square leg for one
crump, that's gone! Dawlat dug the ball in but Wright was quickly back and in position to roundhouse the ball over midwicket and away for another boundary
top response from the bowler, filleting Wright with one that leaps off a length and goes between bat and body and over the stumps
length ball outside off, zips off the pitch as Wright advances and attempts to hit him into the Indian Ocean, only to fail to connect
he gets it right now, full and wide and the ball stays low, Wright hacks off the back foot and under-edges low through to the keeper
woof, that's leapt off the pitch, over Hales attempted pull shot, over the keeper's outstretched hand and away for byes
short and wide and drilled in front of point off the back foot, meaty swing of the bat from Hales
too full on leg stump this time, flicked on the 45 and the fielder on the edge of the circle can't quite get there, four more
length ball, tucked towards mid-off for one
full of a length and outside off, Wright stuffs this back down the ground past mid-off, so fine it almost clocked Hales on the box on its way back
oh, that's gone a long way, steps out and cream-crackers an overpitched delivery over long-on, Wright's Popeye forearms doing maximum damage
length ball outside off, chopped past his stumps wafting away from the body and it rolls to short fine leg
beats Wright's loose prod outside the line of off
pitched up outside off, crashed low through point, opens the face and the ball skitters away to the rope
length ball, pushed into the covers coming forward
touch full, on the stumps and that's a nice pace for Hales to lofted four back down the ground, back over the bowler's head
full and straight and again drilled back down the ground, excellent timing from Hales, slight readjustment and pinged fine past mid-on
tossed up outside off, cut through point to the man on the rope
pushed back to the bowler from in front of the stumps
googly this time, Hales just gets his bat down in time and chops the ball away from in front of the wicket
pushed back past the bowler on the front foot for one
tossed up around off stump, gets forward and blocks
touch short this time, Wright pulls through midwicket, not fully timed but it's between two men and they scamper a second
round the wicket, misses with a swish outside off
tossed up and pushed back down the wicket
turned into the leg side, they push hard and get one, Sadiq then tries to flick the ball at the stumps blind and they pick up another as it rolls away
on the stumps, flicked through leg
tossed up, plays across the line and gets a leading edge that loops in front of extra-cover
pushed through outside off, stays low and disappears under the bat as Hales tries to pull
tossed up outside off, sliced high over the infield and it falls safe out towards deep cover
pushed through outside off, plays and misses with an angled bat
floated up and Wright skips out, blaps the ball straight back down the ground for four to long-on
length ball outside off stump, pushed through the covers
leg stump line, tries to hammer this off the pads but fails to connect
floated towards leg stump again, flicked through backward square and they get back for a couple

full and Wright attacks, drives low back down the track and hits the stumps ... Sadiq got a finger on it, though, and Hales is on his way, run-out backing up! That's unfortunate but sharp work from Sadiq, who got down quickly and just got a touch on the ball as it bounced up and into the top of middle stump
legspinner, outside the line of off, cuts and a thick edge squirts to short third man, who does well to stop it skipping past him
back of a length, outside off, pulled through leg for one
on the pads, flicked through backward square leg this time
short of a length, pitched outside leg from around the wicket, Wright misses with a fiddle and is hit on the pad
pushed through, bit of bounce, flipped in the air through square leg
tossed up outside off, pushed through the covers for one
rolled out on middle and off, Morgan reverses the wrists and sweeps through point, not a great connection but they get one
beats Wright's flashing blade outside off with the regulation legbreak
straighter line, goes back and chops towards point, it's not straight at the man and they're able to steal one
floated up on the stumps, Morgan chips over mid-on with his four iron to the man at wide long-on on the bounce
pushed through on leg stump, worked off the pads through square leg
back of a length, dropped short of point for one
round the wicket, goes back and plays short on the off side where it's quickly fielded
slides through one through, goes on with the arm and hits Morgan on the pad - heading down leg through, and it deflects away to short third mna
drags his length down as Wright leaves the crease, waits on it and then taps to long-on
drifts too far down the leg side this time
tossed up on the stumps, worked back down the pitch, can't beat the bowler
floated up, bit of air and straightening around off, Morgan crouches to pull through square
tossed up on the legs and flicked through midwicket, closing the bat face

over the wicket now from Sadiq and over the rope by Wright! It was tossed up on leg stump, Wright cleared space and boffed it high back down the ground - that landed pretty much in the front row of seats
pushed through a little quicker on the pads, tucked square - that's fifty for Wright
short of a length, pulled hard behind square leg and the fielder on the boundary makes a sliding stop to prevent four
pushed down the ground to long-on
flighted outside off, agricultural heave towards an agricultural part of the ground, the ball skipping away to the rope at cow corner
round the wicket, short and wide, slapped through point to the sweeper
full and outside the line of off, gets down on one knee and sweeps hard and low through square leg
tossed up a bit more, pushed into a gap on the off side
slower, looping delivery from Nabi, as Wright again advances, has to wait and taps through the covers for one
full and outside off, Morgan is beaten in the flight and the ball pops out on the leg side as he brings the bat down at an awkward angle
shorter length, slow pace again, Morgan lofts over extra-cover to the sweeper
pitched up full and fast, clipped off the pads to deep square leg
pitched up on the stumps, punched down the ground
wide on the crease, slower ball, well outside off, bobbles through low as Wright carves a constellation above it
back of a length, takes the pace off again, steered to third man
Morgan steps away and goes on the walk, Dawlat follows him, digs it in at the man and the batsman can only deflect it short towards point

slower ball again, touch of the Dernbachs as it comes out the back of the hand, Wright picked up but slammed his drive straight back at the bowler, its hits Dawlat's boot and deflects to mid-off - dot ball and a grin from Dawlat
flighted on leg stump, barely a flick of the wrists from Morgan but that's gone miles over deep midwicket for six!
flighted on the stumps, squirted through square on the off side
reverses the grip, has to wait on a slow offbreak that sits up, Wright swipes it towards short fine leg and the ball spins and evades the fielder, running through his legs and away for four
another maximum, a full-blooded mow outside off, not the cleanest of connections but it came off the middle of the edge and flew over long-off
chopped into the leg side, out toward deep midwicket, who is foxed by the bounce and the ball spins off his fingertips and on to the ropes
tossed up and swiped through midwicket for a single
full and straight, bump balled back down the ground to long-on
pitched up and hacked back down the ground, wide of long-on for a couple
lofted high extra-cover, skips out and picks the gap - and it's a no-ball. The Afghanistan ship is springing leaks all over the place
skews the free hit down to third man, who drops it. Wouldn't have been out of course, but that's another shell in the field
full-toss, on the stumps, bunted back past the bowler
full and wide, angled across the left-hander, who swings and misses
low full-toss, doesn't connect with a flail across the line and the ball loops to midwicket - he takes the catch, people, he takes the catch!
looped up around the line of off, Buttler tries to reverse paddle straight away and ends up being hit on the grille
speared down the leg side as Buttler advances, Shahzad can't take it cleanly - could have been a stumping chance
dropped, miscues a heave outside the line of off, the ball loops off the edge towards short third man, where Dawlatzai juggles like a circus act before putting the chance down!
tossed up outside off and creamed low through extra-cover, the ball rifled to the rope
tight line, opens the face and thins one fine past the keeper
full and outside off, picked up and blazed over cover for four more, such clean striking from Buttler
full and outside the line of off, squirted down the ground to long-off
dug in at the man and Buttler serves this up over deep midwicket for a one-bounce four

length ball, at the stumps, Buttler clears the front leg ... and is hit on the back pad in front of leg! Taufel raises the finger and Buttler's  brief flicker is snuffed out, Dawlatzai going some way to atoning for his drop in the previous over
pitched up, over-stepped and Bairstow tees off first ball, dumping the bowler back over long-on!
another no-ball, bunted low down the ground for one

pitched up on the stumps, steps across outside off and swings the ball high to deep midwicket, where Stankikzai, I think, takes the catch (which won't count) and then steps on the rope to concede six! If it's not one thing, it's the other for Afghanistan's fielders!
pitched up and smashed over long-off, Wright is seeing it like a beach ball now
full and straight and right in Wright's slot again, he cashes in, mullering another straight slog down the ground, it lands metres beyond the boundary rope at long-on
dragged short, maybe a touch slower, pulled low towards deep square leg for one
full bunger, Wright can't get under it and clatters the ball low down the ground to long-on
pitched up on the stumps, Bairstow scoops h-i-g-h into the leg side, it lands between deep midwicket and wide long-on and bounces over the rope
steps away and heaves a short-of-a-length ball down the ground, baseball style
pitched up, tailing in towards leg stump, good ball from Dawlat and Wright chops it on to his front pad and it rolls away on the off side
slower ball, full and at the stumps, clears the front foot and miscued towards long-on, who takes a solid running catch - the batsmen crossed, though, so Wright will be on strike

low full-toss, gets under it but the ball comes off the bottom part of the bat, loops out towards wide long-on but the fielder gets round, so they can only scamper two and Wright is stuck on 99 not out!
